news.news: Turner amassed 10 points (4-7 FG, 2-4 3Pt), five rebounds, one assist, three blocks and three steals across 31 minutes during Monday's 113-99 victory over the Nets.
news.analysis: Turner continues to show why he can be a defensive force for the Pacers. The veteran big man may be seeing a dip in his offensive production, averaging two fewer points per game (15.1) in more time on the floor this season (31.3). However, he is still one of the elite shot blockers in the NBA, averaging 2.1 per game, fourth in the league behind Anthony Davis (2.2), Walker Kessler (2.5) and Victor Wembanyama (4.0).

news.headline: Third double-double in five games
news.news: Turner closed Thursday's 128-115 win over the Heat with 21 points (8-15 FG, 2-5 3Pt, 3-4 FT), five rebounds, two assists, two blocks and one steal over 35 minutes.

news.headline: Strong on both ends in defeat
news.news: Turner amassed 16 points (7-12 FG, 2-5 3Pt), 10 rebounds, two assists and one block across 33 minutes during Tuesday's 120-112 loss to Milwaukee.
news.analysis: Subscribe now to instantly reveal our take on this news.

news.headline: Good to go against OKC
news.news: Turner ended Thursday's 120-114 loss to Oklahoma City with 12 points (4-13 FG, 1-6 3Pt, 3-6 FT), 11 rebounds, two assists and five blocks across 33 minutes.

news.headline: Questionable for Thursday
news.news: Turner (oblique) is available for Thursday's game versus the Thunder, Tony East of SI.com reports.

news.news: Turner is questionable to play Thursday versus Oklahoma City due to a right oblique contusion.
